summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) to the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, Damian Williams, transmitting a draft OIG report for review. The draft report concerns the investigation into the Federal Bureau of Prisons' custody, care, and supervision of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The memo requests a factual accuracy and sensitivity review by SDNY.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General has completed a draft report investigating the Federal Bureau of Prisons' handling of Jeffrey Epstein while he was in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

The draft report is being provided to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), led by Damian Williams, for a factual accuracy and sensitivity review prior to public release.
The memo imposes strict confidentiality, prohibiting dissemination or discussion of the draft report outside of necessary SDNY employees and requiring a log of who accesses it.
The document indicates an ongoing, high-level internal review within the DOJ concerning the circumstances surrounding Epstein's incarceration and death.
